Class Monitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Monitor
  • public class Monitor
extends java.lang.Object
    The Monitor class represents a centralised system whose decides which lift will handle a request.

    An instance from Monitor has 7 variables:

    • A list of all the lifts associated to the monitor.
    • The number of the lift in the list.
    • The maximal floor.
    • The capacity of the lifts.
    • The speed of the lifts.
    • The average waiting time of the people who have a request.
    • The requests
    See Also:
    Lift, Person, Requests

      • Monitor

        public Monitor​(java.lang.String ParameterFile,
               java.lang.String RequestsFile)
        Constucts an instance of the Monitor class. It reads a file put in parameter and uses the information contained in it to implement its variables.
        Parameters:
        ParameterFile - The name of the file where the information concernings the parameters are.
        RequestsFile - The name of the file where the information concernings the requests are.

      • getIdChosenLift

        public int getIdChosenLift​(Person p)
        Returns an integer corresponding to the identificator of the chosen lift that can possibly process the person's request. The lift is chosen at a certain time. It is not the final value as another lift can address the person's request first. With the filter, all the lifts that are in the right direction to the Person's start floor are keeped. With the map, the distance between the person and the lifts kept are computed.
        Parameters:
        p - The Person that has to be affected to a lift.
        Returns:
        int

      • computeAvgWaitingTime

        public float computeAvgWaitingTime()
        Computes the average amount of time a person waits for a lift.
        Returns:
        int
